comments.body: I'm no bash expert, but should {1..${NUM_MINIONS}} have a $ in front?

It's using the range expansion voodoo in bash (
http://wiki.bash-hackers.org/syntax/expansion/brace#ranges ), similar to
how cluster/gce/config-default.sh is doing it.

$ echo foo-{1..3}
foo-1 foo-2 foo-3

On Wed, Jan 14, 2015 at 12:38 PM, Daniel Smith notifications@github.com
wrote:

> In cluster/gke/config-common.sh
> https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pull/3473#discussion-diff-22967972
> :
> 
> > @@ -21,6 +21,7 @@
> >  MASTER_NAME="k8s-${CLUSTER_NAME}-master"
> >  ZONE="${ZONE:-us-central1-f}"
> >  NUM_MINIONS="${NUM_MINIONS:-2}"
> > +MINION_NAMES=($(eval echo "k8s-${CLUSTER_NAME}-node-{1..${NUM_MINIONS}}"))
> 
> I'm no bash expert, but should {1..${NUM_MINIONS}} have a $ in front?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pull/3473/files#r22967972
> .

Yeah but it doesn't work inside quotes.

``` bash
$ echo "{1..3}"
{1..3}
```

Yes, but eval? (Also, MINION_IP_RANGES uses quotes, too)

$ A=($(eval echo "foo-{1..3}")); echo "${A[@]}"
foo-1 foo-2 foo-3

On Wed, Jan 14, 2015 at 12:57 PM, Daniel Smith notifications@github.com
wrote:

> In cluster/gke/config-common.sh
> https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pull/3473#discussion-diff-22969236
> :

> > @@ -21,6 +21,7 @@
> >  MASTER_NAME="k8s-${CLUSTER_NAME}-master"
> >  ZONE="${ZONE:-us-central1-f}"
> >  NUM_MINIONS="${NUM_MINIONS:-2}"
> > +MINION_NAMES=($(eval echo "k8s-${CLUSTER_NAME}-node-{1..${NUM_MINIONS}}"))
> 
> Yeah but it doesn't work inside quotes.
> 
> $ echo "{1..3}"
> {1..3}
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pull/3473/files#r22969236
> .

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +22,26 @@ZONE="${ZONE:-us-central1-f}"
NUM_MINIONS="${NUM_MINIONS:-2}"
MINION_NAMES=($(eval echo "k8s-${CLUSTER_NAME}-node-{1..${NUM_MINIONS}}"))
CLUSTER_API_VERSION="${CLUSTER_API_VERSION:-}"
# TODO(mbforbes): Actually plumb this through; this currently only works
